com.ucd.comp41690.team21.zenze.game.components

Class PhysicsComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ucd.comp41690.team21.zenze.game.components.PhysicsComponent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttackPhysics, EnemyPhysics, PlayerPhysics

    public class PhysicsComponent
extends java.lang.Object
    controlls the physical behaviour of the game's objects

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PhysicsComponent.AABB
      a rectangular bounding volume
      class  PhysicsComponent.BoundingVolume
      a super class for bounding volumes
      static class  PhysicsComponent.Collision
      reflects the type or position of a collision
      class  PhysicsComponent.Sphere
      a spherical bounding volume

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsComponent

        public PhysicsComponent(int boundingVolume,
                        float x,
                        float y,
                        float scale)
        creates a new physics component
        Parameters:
        boundingVolume - indicates the objects bounding volume, either spherical or rectangular
        x - the x position of the bounding volume, should match the objects one
        y - the y position of the bounding volume, should match the objects one
        scale - the scale of the bounding volume

    • Method Detail

      • handlePhysics

        public void handlePhysics(GameObject object,
                          double elapsedTime)
        updates an objects bounding volume, position and reactes to collisions
        Parameters:
        object - the object to update
        elapsedTime - the elapsed time since the last update

      • leapFrogIntegration

        public void leapFrogIntegration(GameObject object,
                                double elapsedTime,
                                float damping)
        updates an objects position using leap frog integration for more stable results than euler
        Parameters:
        object - the object whose position should be updated
        elapsedTime - the elapsed time since the last update
        damping - a damping factor that can be used to slow down the object eg. incase of jumping

      • resolveSolidCollision

        public void resolveSolidCollision(PhysicsComponent.Collision col,
                                  GameObject player,
                                  GameObject o)
        resolves a collision with a solid object and a spherical one
        Parameters:
        col - the type of collision to resolve
        player - the object with a spherical bounding volume
        o - the solid object, can be spherical or rectangular

      • intersects

        public PhysicsComponent.Collision intersects(PhysicsComponent.BoundingVolume a,
                                             PhysicsComponent.BoundingVolume b)
        checking for intersection between two bounding volumes
        Parameters:
        a - the first bounding volume
        b - the second bounding volume
        Returns:
        the type of collision

      • intersects

        public PhysicsComponent.Collision intersects(PhysicsComponent.Sphere sphere,
                                             PhysicsComponent.AABB rect)
        collision detection between a sphere and an axis aligned rectangle
        Parameters:
        sphere - a spherical bounding volume
        rect - an axis aligned rectangular bounding volume
        Returns:
        the type of collision between the two volumes

      • intersects

        public PhysicsComponent.Collision intersects(PhysicsComponent.Sphere a,
                                             PhysicsComponent.Sphere b)
        checks for collsions between two spherical bounding volumes
        Parameters:
        a - the first sphere
        b - the second sphere
        Returns:
        the type of collision between the two volumes

      • getCollisionPoint

        public float[] getCollisionPoint(PhysicsComponent.Sphere a,
                                 PhysicsComponent.Sphere b)
        returns the point to which to reset the first object in case of collision
        Parameters:
        a - the first colliding sphere which should be moved out of the second object
        b - the second bounding volume which remains in place
        Returns:
        an array containing x and y coordinates for the new object position
